name: undirected
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not involving, or not having been given, rules or instructions about what to do or say: The children spend most of their time in undirected play. At such a stressful time, she wanted to feel unobserved and undirected.
not having a clear purpose, or not intending to achieve a particular thing: Try not to ask the witness undirected or irrelevant questions. I realized that the research was driven by general curiosity - that it was undirected research.
More examplesFewer examplesUndirected play allows children to learn how to work in groups, to share, and to resolve conflicts.They criticized the administration's undirected, scattergun approach to counterterrorism.The claim that evolution is purposeless and undirected is almost an article of faith among evolutionary biologists.
